{"id":1466753248,"question_id":2729,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 months, 1 week","timestamp":1732995682,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"42 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1466753248/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Operations to Make Numbers Non-positive","memory":"78.2 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int minOperations(vector<int>& nums, int x, int y) {\n        int left = 0;\n        int right = INT_MAX/2;\n        while(left<right) {\n            int mid = left+(right-left)/2;\n            if(isOK(mid, nums, x, y)) {\n                right = mid;\n            } else\n                left = mid+1;\n        }\n        return left;\n    }\n    bool isOK(int mid, vector<int>& nums, int x, int y) {\n        int count = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<nums.size(); i++) {\n            if(nums[i] <= 1.0* mid * y)\n                continue;\n            count += ceil( (nums[i]-mid*1.0*y)/(x-y) );\n            if(count > mid)\n                return false;\n        }\n        return true;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-operations-to-make-numbers-non-positive","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
